    Example metabefor Rmd file

    Gjalt-Jorn Peters

    2019-02-18

    example-metabefor-rmd-file.Rmd
    require('metabefor');
#> Loading required package: metabefor
### Using a temporary directory in this vignette
workingPath <- tempdir();

    Queries

    
###----------------------------------------------------------------------------
### Specify first query
###----------------------------------------------------------------------------

query <-
  query_full(
    inclusion =
      query_requiredConcepts(
        conceptName = "inclusion",
        query_conceptTerms(
          conceptName="fluffiness",
          "fluffy",
          "hairy",
          "soft"),
        query_conceptTerms(
          conceptName="aggression",
          "aggressi*",
          "predator*",
          "kill*")),
    exclusion = 
      query_conceptTerms(
        conceptName = "exclude non-empirical work",
        "review",
        "meta-analysis"));

### Note that PsycINFO subsumes PsycARTICLES, and PubMed subsumes MEDLINE (see
### "Is PsycARTICLES cross-linked with any outside databases or journals?" at
### http://www.apa.org/pubs/databases/psycarticles/faq.aspx for PsycINFO and
### and http://askus.library.tmc.edu/faq/2018 for MEDLINE

###----------------------------------------------------------------------------
### Specify screening exclusion criteria - should correspond to query concepts
###----------------------------------------------------------------------------

exclusion <-
  exclusion_criteria(notEmpirical = "Not an empirical study (e.g. a review or debate paper)",
                     notFluffy = "Fluffiness is not assessed");
    
searches <- list();
searches[[1]] <-
  specify_search(date = "2019-03-03",
                 query = query,
                 databases = list(psycinfo = list(interface = "ebsco",
                                                  fileFormat = "ris"),
                                  pubmed = list(interface= "pubmed",
                                                fileFormat = "ris")),
                 fields = "title");

    First search, executed at: 2019-03-03

    The query used in this search is:

    plot(searches[[1]]$query);
    Temporarily removed figure until I get V8 to work in GitLab CI.

    In this query, the searched terms must occur in entries’ title fields.

    query_toInterfaceLang(searches[[1]]$query,
                      fields=searches[[1]]$fields,
                      exclude=searches[[1]]$exclude);
#>  PUBMED QUERY:
#> (((fluffy [TI]) OR (hairy [TI]) OR (soft [TI]) OR (aggressi* [TI]) OR (predator* [TI]) OR (kill* [TI])) AND ((fluffy [TI]) OR (hairy [TI]) OR (soft [TI])) AND ((aggressi* [TI]) OR (predator* [TI]) OR (kill* [TI])) AND ((review [TI]) OR (meta-analysis [TI])))
#> 
#>  EBSCOHOST QUERY:
#> ((TI  ("fluffy" OR "hairy" OR "soft" OR "aggressi*" OR "predator*" OR "kill*"))) AND ((TI  ("fluffy" OR "hairy" OR "soft"))) AND ((TI  ("aggressi*" OR "predator*" OR "kill*"))) AND ((TI  ("review" OR "meta-analysis")))
#> 
#>  OVID QUERY:
#> ((("fluffy" OR "hairy" OR "soft" OR "aggressi*" OR "predator*" OR "kill*") AND ("fluffy" OR "hairy" OR "soft") AND ("aggressi*" OR "predator*" OR "kill*") AND ("review" OR "meta-analysis"))).ti
#> 
#> NOTE: export the results as .RIS files, called 'MEDLINE' in PubMed.
